00064                         const struct cl_object_conf *conf,
00065                         union lov_layout_state *state);
00066         int (*llo_delete)(const struct lu_env *env, struct lov_object *lov,
00067                            union lov_layout_state *state);

00069                          union lov_layout_state *state);

00071                             union lov_layout_state *state);

00073                           lu_printer_t p, const struct lu_object *o);
00074         int  (*llo_page_init)(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_object *obj,
00075                               struct cl_page *page, pgoff_t index);
00076         int  (*llo_lock_init)(const struct lu_env *env,
00077                               struct cl_object *obj, struct cl_lock *lock,
00078                               const struct cl_io *io);
00079         int  (*llo_io_init)(const struct lu_env *env,
00080                             struct cl_object *obj, struct cl_io *io);
00081         int  (*llo_getattr)(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_object *obj,
00082                             struct cl_attr *attr);
00083 };

00122 static struct cl_object *lov_sub_find(const struct lu_env *env,
00123                                       struct cl_device *dev,
00124                                       const struct lu_fid *fid,
00125                                       const struct cl_object_conf *conf)
00126 {
00127         struct lu_object *o;
00128 
00129         ENTRY;
00130         o = lu_object_find_at(env, cl2lu_dev(dev), fid, &conf->coc_lu);
00131         LASSERT(ergo(!IS_ERR(o), o->lo_dev->ld_type == &lovsub_device_type));
00132         RETURN(lu2cl(o));
00133 }

00135 static int lov_init_sub(const struct lu_env *env, struct lov_object *lov,
00136                         struct cl_object *stripe, struct lov_layout_raid0 *r0,
00137                         int idx)
00138 {
00139         struct cl_object_header *hdr;
00140         struct cl_object_header *subhdr;
00141         struct cl_object_header *parent;
00142         struct lov_oinfo        *oinfo;
00143         int result;
00144 
00145         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_LOV_INIT)) {
00146                 /* For sanity:test_206.
00147                  * Do not leave the object in cache to avoid accessing
00148                  * freed memory. This is because osc_object is referring to
00149                  * lov_oinfo of lsm_stripe_data which will be freed due to
00150                  * this failure. */
00151                 cl_object_kill(env, stripe);
00152                 cl_object_put(env, stripe);
00153                 return -EIO;
00154         }
00155 
00156         hdr    = cl_object_header(lov2cl(lov));
00157         subhdr = cl_object_header(stripe);
00158 
00159         oinfo = lov->lo_lsm->lsm_oinfo[idx];
00160         CDEBUG(D_INODE, DFID"@%p[%d] -> "DFID"@%p: ostid: "DOSTID
00161                " idx: %d gen: %d\n",
00162                PFID(&subhdr->coh_lu.loh_fid), subhdr, idx,
00163                PFID(&hdr->coh_lu.loh_fid), hdr, POSTID(&oinfo->loi_oi),
00164                oinfo->loi_ost_idx, oinfo->loi_ost_gen);
00165 
00166         /* reuse ->coh_attr_guard to protect coh_parent change */
00167         spin_lock(&subhdr->coh_attr_guard);
00168         parent = subhdr->coh_parent;
00169         if (parent == NULL) {
00170                 subhdr->coh_parent = hdr;
00171                 spin_unlock(&subhdr->coh_attr_guard);
00172                 subhdr->coh_nesting = hdr->coh_nesting + 1;
00173                 lu_object_ref_add(&stripe->co_lu, "lov-parent", lov);
00174                 r0->lo_sub[idx] = cl2lovsub(stripe);
00175                 r0->lo_sub[idx]->lso_super = lov;
00176                 r0->lo_sub[idx]->lso_index = idx;
00177                 result = 0;
00178         } else {
00179                 struct lu_object  *old_obj;
00180                 struct lov_object *old_lov;
00181                 unsigned int mask = D_INODE;
00182 
00183                 spin_unlock(&subhdr->coh_attr_guard);
00184                 old_obj = lu_object_locate(&parent->coh_lu, &lov_device_type);
00185                 LASSERT(old_obj != NULL);
00186                 old_lov = cl2lov(lu2cl(old_obj));
00187                 if (old_lov->lo_layout_invalid) {
00188                         /* the object's layout has already changed but isn't
00189                          * refreshed */
00190                         lu_object_unhash(env, &stripe->co_lu);
00191                         result = -EAGAIN;
00192                 } else {
00193                         mask = D_ERROR;
00194                         result = -EIO;
00195                 }
00196 
00197                 LU_OBJECT_DEBUG(mask, env, &stripe->co_lu,
00198                                 "stripe %d is already owned.", idx);
00199                 LU_OBJECT_DEBUG(mask, env, old_obj, "owned.");
00200                 LU_OBJECT_HEADER(mask, env, lov2lu(lov), "try to own.\n");
00201                 cl_object_put(env, stripe);
00202         }
00203         return result;
00204 }
00205 
00206 static int lov_page_slice_fixup(struct lov_object *lov,
00207                                 struct cl_object *stripe)
00208 {
00209         struct cl_object_header *hdr = cl_object_header(&lov->lo_cl);
00210         struct cl_object *o;
00211 
00212         if (stripe == NULL)
00213                 return hdr->coh_page_bufsize - lov->lo_cl.co_slice_off -
00214                        cfs_size_round(sizeof(struct lov_page));
00215 
00216         cl_object_for_each(o, stripe)
00217                 o->co_slice_off += hdr->coh_page_bufsize;
00218 
00219         return cl_object_header(stripe)->coh_page_bufsize;
00220 }
00221 
00222 static int lov_init_raid0(const struct lu_env *env, struct lov_device *dev,
00223                           struct lov_object *lov, struct lov_stripe_md *lsm,
00224                           const struct cl_object_conf *conf,
00225                           union lov_layout_state *state)
00226 {
00227         int result;
00228         int i;
00229 
00230         struct cl_object        *stripe;
00231         struct lov_thread_info  *lti     = lov_env_info(env);
00232         struct cl_object_conf   *subconf = &lti->lti_stripe_conf;
00233         struct lu_fid           *ofid    = &lti->lti_fid;
00234         struct lov_layout_raid0 *r0      = &state->raid0;
00235 
00236         ENTRY;
00237 
00238         if (lsm->lsm_magic != LOV_MAGIC_V1 && lsm->lsm_magic != LOV_MAGIC_V3) {
00239                 dump_lsm(D_ERROR, lsm);
00240                 LASSERTF(0, "magic mismatch, expected %d/%d, actual %d.\n",
00241                          LOV_MAGIC_V1, LOV_MAGIC_V3, lsm->lsm_magic);
00242         }
00243 
00244         LASSERT(lov->lo_lsm == NULL);
00245         lov->lo_lsm = lsm_addref(lsm);
00246         r0->lo_nr = lsm->lsm_stripe_count;
00247         LASSERT(r0->lo_nr <= lov_targets_nr(dev));
00248 
00249         lov->lo_layout_invalid = true;
00250 
00251         OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(r0->lo_sub, r0->lo_nr * sizeof r0->lo_sub[0]);
00252         if (r0->lo_sub != NULL) {
00253                 int psz = 0;
00254 
00255                 result = 0;
00256                 subconf->coc_inode = conf->coc_inode;
00257                 spin_lock_init(&r0->lo_sub_lock);
00258                 /*
00259                  * Create stripe cl_objects.
00260                  */
00261                 for (i = 0; i < r0->lo_nr && result == 0; ++i) {
00262                         struct cl_device *subdev;
00263                         struct lov_oinfo *oinfo = lsm->lsm_oinfo[i];
00264                         int ost_idx = oinfo->loi_ost_idx;
00265 
00266                         if (lov_oinfo_is_dummy(oinfo))
00267                                 continue;
00268 
00269                         result = ostid_to_fid(ofid, &oinfo->loi_oi,
00270                                               oinfo->loi_ost_idx);
00271                         if (result != 0)
00272                                 GOTO(out, result);
00273 
00274                         subdev = lovsub2cl_dev(dev->ld_target[ost_idx]);
00275                         subconf->u.coc_oinfo = oinfo;
00276                         LASSERTF(subdev != NULL, "not init ost %d\n", ost_idx);
00277                         /* In the function below, .hs_keycmp resolves to
00278                          * lu_obj_hop_keycmp() */
00279                         /* coverity[overrun-buffer-val] */
00280                         stripe = lov_sub_find(env, subdev, ofid, subconf);
00281                         if (!IS_ERR(stripe)) {
00282                                 result = lov_init_sub(env, lov, stripe, r0, i);
00283                                 if (result == -EAGAIN) { /* try again */
00284                                         --i;
00285                                         result = 0;
00286                                         continue;
00287                                 }
00288                         } else {
00289                                 result = PTR_ERR(stripe);
00290                         }
00291 
00292                         if (result == 0) {
00293                                 int sz = lov_page_slice_fixup(lov, stripe);
00294                                 LASSERT(ergo(psz > 0, psz == sz));
00295                                 psz = sz;
00296                         }
00297                 }
00298                 if (result == 0)
00299                         cl_object_header(&lov->lo_cl)->coh_page_bufsize += psz;
00300         } else
00301                 result = -ENOMEM;
00302 out:
00303         RETURN(result);
00304 }
00305 
00306 static int lov_init_released(const struct lu_env *env,
00307                              struct lov_device *dev, struct lov_object *lov,
00308                              struct lov_stripe_md *lsm,
00309                              const struct cl_object_conf *conf,
00310                              union lov_layout_state *state)
00311 {
00312         LASSERT(lsm != NULL);
00313         LASSERT(lsm_is_released(lsm));
00314         LASSERT(lov->lo_lsm == NULL);
00315 
00316         lov->lo_lsm = lsm_addref(lsm);
00317         return 0;
00318 }

00320 static struct cl_object *lov_find_subobj(const struct lu_env *env,
00321                                          struct lov_object *lov,
00322                                          struct lov_stripe_md *lsm,
00323                                          int stripe_idx)
00324 {
00325         struct lov_device       *dev = lu2lov_dev(lov2lu(lov)->lo_dev);
00326         struct lov_oinfo        *oinfo = lsm->lsm_oinfo[stripe_idx];
00327         struct lov_thread_info  *lti = lov_env_info(env);
00328         struct lu_fid           *ofid = &lti->lti_fid;
00329         struct cl_device        *subdev;
00330         int                     ost_idx;
00331         int                     rc;
00332         struct cl_object        *result;
00333 
00334         if (lov->lo_type != LLT_RAID0)
00335                 GOTO(out, result = NULL);
00336 
00337         ost_idx = oinfo->loi_ost_idx;
00338         rc = ostid_to_fid(ofid, &oinfo->loi_oi, ost_idx);
00339         if (rc != 0)
00340                 GOTO(out, result = NULL);
00341 
00342         subdev = lovsub2cl_dev(dev->ld_target[ost_idx]);
00343         result = lov_sub_find(env, subdev, ofid, NULL);
00344 out:
00345         if (result == NULL)
00346                 result = ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
00347         return result;
00348 }

00351                             union lov_layout_state *state)
00352 {
00353         LASSERT(lov->lo_type == LLT_EMPTY || lov->lo_type == LLT_RELEASED);
00354 
00355         lov_layout_wait(env, lov);
00356         return 0;
00357 }

00359 static void lov_subobject_kill(const struct lu_env *env, struct lov_object *lov,
00360                                struct lovsub_object *los, int idx)
00361 {
00362         struct cl_object        *sub;
00363         struct lov_layout_raid0 *r0;
00364         struct lu_site          *site;
00365         struct lu_site_bkt_data *bkt;
00366         wait_queue_t          *waiter;
00367 
00368         r0  = &lov->u.raid0;
00369         LASSERT(r0->lo_sub[idx] == los);
00370 
00371         sub  = lovsub2cl(los);
00372         site = sub->co_lu.lo_dev->ld_site;
00373         bkt  = lu_site_bkt_from_fid(site, &sub->co_lu.lo_header->loh_fid);
00374 
00375         cl_object_kill(env, sub);
00376         /* release a reference to the sub-object and ... */
00377         lu_object_ref_del(&sub->co_lu, "lov-parent", lov);
00378         cl_object_put(env, sub);
00379 
00380         /* ... wait until it is actually destroyed---sub-object clears its
00381          * ->lo_sub[] slot in lovsub_object_fini() */
00382         if (r0->lo_sub[idx] == los) {
00383                 waiter = &lov_env_info(env)->lti_waiter;
00384                 init_waitqueue_entry(waiter, current);
00385                 add_wait_queue(&bkt->lsb_marche_funebre, waiter);
00386                 set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00387                 while (1) {
00388                         /* this wait-queue is signaled at the end of
00389                          * lu_object_free(). */
00390                         set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00391                         spin_lock(&r0->lo_sub_lock);
00392                         if (r0->lo_sub[idx] == los) {
00393                                 spin_unlock(&r0->lo_sub_lock);
00394                                 schedule();
00395                         } else {
00396                                 spin_unlock(&r0->lo_sub_lock);
00397                                 set_current_state(TASK_RUNNING);
00398                                 break;
00399                         }
00400                 }
00401                 remove_wait_queue(&bkt->lsb_marche_funebre, waiter);
00402         }
00403         LASSERT(r0->lo_sub[idx] == NULL);
00404 }
00405 
00406 static int lov_delete_raid0(const struct lu_env *env, struct lov_object *lov,
00407                             union lov_layout_state *state)
00408 {
00409         struct lov_layout_raid0 *r0 = &state->raid0;
00410         struct lov_stripe_md    *lsm = lov->lo_lsm;
00411         int i;
00412 
00413         ENTRY;
00414 
00415         dump_lsm(D_INODE, lsm);
00416 
00417         lov_layout_wait(env, lov);
00418         if (r0->lo_sub != NULL) {
00419                 for (i = 0; i < r0->lo_nr; ++i) {
00420                         struct lovsub_object *los = r0->lo_sub[i];
00421 
00422                         if (los != NULL) {
00423                                 cl_object_prune(env, &los->lso_cl);
00424                                 /*
00425                                  * If top-level object is to be evicted from
00426                                  * the cache, so are its sub-objects.
00427                                  */
00428                                 lov_subobject_kill(env, lov, los, i);
00429                         }
00430                 }
00431         }
00432         RETURN(0);
00433 }

00441 static void lov_fini_raid0(const struct lu_env *env, struct lov_object *lov,
00442                            union lov_layout_state *state)
00443 {
00444         struct lov_layout_raid0 *r0 = &state->raid0;
00445         ENTRY;
00446 
00447         if (r0->lo_sub != NULL) {
00448                 OBD_FREE_LARGE(r0->lo_sub, r0->lo_nr * sizeof r0->lo_sub[0]);
00449                 r0->lo_sub = NULL;
00450         }
00451 
00452         dump_lsm(D_INODE, lov->lo_lsm);
00453         lov_free_memmd(&lov->lo_lsm);
00454 
00455         EXIT;
00456 }

00474 static int lov_print_raid0(const struct lu_env *env, void *cookie,
00475                            lu_printer_t p, const struct lu_object *o)
00476 {
00477         struct lov_object       *lov = lu2lov(o);
00478         struct lov_layout_raid0 *r0  = lov_r0(lov);
00479         struct lov_stripe_md    *lsm = lov->lo_lsm;
00480         int                      i;
00481 
00482         (*p)(env, cookie, "stripes: %d, %s, lsm{%p 0x%08X %d %u %u}:\n",
00483                 r0->lo_nr, lov->lo_layout_invalid ? "invalid" : "valid", lsm,
00484                 lsm->lsm_magic, atomic_read(&lsm->lsm_refc),
00485                 lsm->lsm_stripe_count, lsm->lsm_layout_gen);
00486         for (i = 0; i < r0->lo_nr; ++i) {
00487                 struct lu_object *sub;
00488 
00489                 if (r0->lo_sub[i] != NULL) {
00490                         sub = lovsub2lu(r0->lo_sub[i]);
00491                         lu_object_print(env, cookie, p, sub);
00492                 } else {
00493                         (*p)(env, cookie, "sub %d absent\n", i);
00494                 }
00495         }
00496         return 0;
00497 }

00508                 lsm->lsm_magic, atomic_read(&lsm->lsm_refc),
00509                 lsm->lsm_stripe_count, lsm->lsm_layout_gen);
00510         return 0;
00511 }

00526 
00527 static int lov_attr_get_raid0(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_object *obj,
00528                               struct cl_attr *attr)
00529 {
00530         struct lov_object       *lov = cl2lov(obj);
00531         struct lov_layout_raid0 *r0 = lov_r0(lov);
00532         struct cl_attr          *lov_attr = &r0->lo_attr;
00533         int                      result = 0;
00534 
00535         ENTRY;
00536 
00537         /* this is called w/o holding type guard mutex, so it must be inside
00538          * an on going IO otherwise lsm may be replaced.
00539          * LU-2117: it turns out there exists one exception. For mmaped files,
00540          * the lock of those files may be requested in the other file's IO
00541          * context, and this function is called in ccc_lock_state(), it will
00542          * hit this assertion.
00543          * Anyway, it's still okay to call attr_get w/o type guard as layout
00544          * can't go if locks exist. */
00545         /* LASSERT(atomic_read(&lsm->lsm_refc) > 1); */
00546 
00547         if (!r0->lo_attr_valid) {
00548                 struct lov_stripe_md    *lsm = lov->lo_lsm;
00549                 struct ost_lvb          *lvb = &lov_env_info(env)->lti_lvb;
00550                 __u64                    kms = 0;
00551 
00552                 memset(lvb, 0, sizeof(*lvb));
00553                 /* XXX: timestamps can be negative by sanity:test_39m,
00554                  * how can it be? */
00555                 lvb->lvb_atime = LLONG_MIN;
00556                 lvb->lvb_ctime = LLONG_MIN;
00557                 lvb->lvb_mtime = LLONG_MIN;
00558 
00559                 /*
00560                  * XXX that should be replaced with a loop over sub-objects,
00561                  * doing cl_object_attr_get() on them. But for now, let's
00562                  * reuse old lov code.
00563                  */
00564 
00565                 /*
00566                  * XXX take lsm spin-lock to keep lov_merge_lvb_kms()
00567                  * happy. It's not needed, because new code uses
00568                  * ->coh_attr_guard spin-lock to protect consistency of
00569                  * sub-object attributes.
00570                  */
00571                 lov_stripe_lock(lsm);
00572                 result = lov_merge_lvb_kms(lsm, lvb, &kms);
00573                 lov_stripe_unlock(lsm);
00574                 if (result == 0) {
00575                         cl_lvb2attr(lov_attr, lvb);
00576                         lov_attr->cat_kms = kms;
00577                         r0->lo_attr_valid = 1;
00578                 }
00579         }
00580         if (result == 0) { /* merge results */
00581                 attr->cat_blocks = lov_attr->cat_blocks;
00582                 attr->cat_size = lov_attr->cat_size;
00583                 attr->cat_kms = lov_attr->cat_kms;
00584                 if (attr->cat_atime < lov_attr->cat_atime)
00585                         attr->cat_atime = lov_attr->cat_atime;
00586                 if (attr->cat_ctime < lov_attr->cat_ctime)
00587                         attr->cat_ctime = lov_attr->cat_ctime;
00588                 if (attr->cat_mtime < lov_attr->cat_mtime)
00589                         attr->cat_mtime = lov_attr->cat_mtime;
00590         }
00591         RETURN(result);
00592 }
00593 
00594 const static struct lov_layout_operations lov_dispatch[] = {
00595         [LLT_EMPTY] = {
00596                 .llo_init      = lov_init_empty,
00597                 .llo_delete    = lov_delete_empty,
00598                 .llo_fini      = lov_fini_empty,
00599                 .llo_install   = lov_install_empty,
00600                 .llo_print     = lov_print_empty,
00601                 .llo_page_init = lov_page_init_empty,
00602                 .llo_lock_init = lov_lock_init_empty,
00603                 .llo_io_init   = lov_io_init_empty,
00604                 .llo_getattr   = lov_attr_get_empty,
00605         },
00606         [LLT_RAID0] = {
00607                 .llo_init      = lov_init_raid0,
00608                 .llo_delete    = lov_delete_raid0,
00609                 .llo_fini      = lov_fini_raid0,
00610                 .llo_install   = lov_install_raid0,
00611                 .llo_print     = lov_print_raid0,
00612                 .llo_page_init = lov_page_init_raid0,
00613                 .llo_lock_init = lov_lock_init_raid0,
00614                 .llo_io_init   = lov_io_init_raid0,
00615                 .llo_getattr   = lov_attr_get_raid0,
00616         },
00617         [LLT_RELEASED] = {
00618                 .llo_init      = lov_init_released,
00619                 .llo_delete    = lov_delete_empty,
00620                 .llo_fini      = lov_fini_released,
00621                 .llo_install   = lov_install_empty,
00622                 .llo_print     = lov_print_released,
00623                 .llo_page_init = lov_page_init_empty,
00624                 .llo_lock_init = lov_lock_init_empty,
00625                 .llo_io_init   = lov_io_init_released,
00626                 .llo_getattr   = lov_attr_get_empty,
00627         }
00628 };
00629 
00633 #define LOV_2DISPATCH_NOLOCK(obj, op, ...)                              \
00634 ({                                                                      \
00635         struct lov_object                      *__obj = (obj);          \
00636         enum lov_layout_type                    __llt;                  \
00637                                                                         \
00638         __llt = __obj->lo_type;                                         \
00639         LASSERT(0 <= __llt && __llt < ARRAY_SIZE(lov_dispatch));        \
00640         lov_dispatch[__llt].op(__VA_ARGS__);                            \
00641 })
00642 
00646 static enum lov_layout_type lov_type(struct lov_stripe_md *lsm)
00647 {
00648         if (lsm == NULL)
00649                 return LLT_EMPTY;
00650         if (lsm_is_released(lsm))
00651                 return LLT_RELEASED;
00652         return LLT_RAID0;
00653 }
00654 
00655 static inline void lov_conf_freeze(struct lov_object *lov)
00656 {
00657         if (lov->lo_owner != current)
00658                 down_read(&lov->lo_type_guard);
00659 }
00660 
00661 static inline void lov_conf_thaw(struct lov_object *lov)
00662 {
00663         if (lov->lo_owner != current)
00664                 up_read(&lov->lo_type_guard);
00665 }
00666 
00667 #define LOV_2DISPATCH_MAYLOCK(obj, op, lock, ...)                       \
00668 ({                                                                      \
00669         struct lov_object                      *__obj = (obj);          \
00670         int                                     __lock = !!(lock);      \
00671         typeof(lov_dispatch[0].op(__VA_ARGS__)) __result;               \
00672                                                                         \
00673         if (__lock)                                                     \
00674                 lov_conf_freeze(__obj);                                 \
00675         __result = LOV_2DISPATCH_NOLOCK(obj, op, __VA_ARGS__);          \
00676         if (__lock)                                                     \
00677                 lov_conf_thaw(__obj);                                   \
00678         __result;                                                       \
00679 })
00680 
00684 #define LOV_2DISPATCH(obj, op, ...)                     \
00685         LOV_2DISPATCH_MAYLOCK(obj, op, 1, __VA_ARGS__)
00686 
00687 #define LOV_2DISPATCH_VOID(obj, op, ...)                                \
00688 do {                                                                    \
00689         struct lov_object                      *__obj = (obj);          \
00690         enum lov_layout_type                    __llt;                  \
00691                                                                         \
00692         lov_conf_freeze(__obj);                                         \
00693         __llt = __obj->lo_type;                                         \
00694         LASSERT(0 <= __llt && __llt < ARRAY_SIZE(lov_dispatch));        \
00695         lov_dispatch[__llt].op(__VA_ARGS__);                            \
00696         lov_conf_thaw(__obj);                                           \
00697 } while (0)
00698 
00699 static void lov_conf_lock(struct lov_object *lov)
00700 {
00701         LASSERT(lov->lo_owner != current);
00702         down_write(&lov->lo_type_guard);
00703         LASSERT(lov->lo_owner == NULL);
00704         lov->lo_owner = current;
00705 }
00706 
00707 static void lov_conf_unlock(struct lov_object *lov)
00708 {
00709         lov->lo_owner = NULL;
00710         up_write(&lov->lo_type_guard);
00711 }
00712 
00713 static int lov_layout_wait(const struct lu_env *env, struct lov_object *lov)
00714 {
00715         struct l_wait_info lwi = { 0 };
00716         ENTRY;
00717 
00718         while (atomic_read(&lov->lo_active_ios) > 0) {
00719                 CDEBUG(D_INODE, "file:"DFID" wait for active IO, now: %d.\n",
00720                         PFID(lu_object_fid(lov2lu(lov))),
00721                         atomic_read(&lov->lo_active_ios));
00722 
00723                 l_wait_event(lov->lo_waitq,
00724                              atomic_read(&lov->lo_active_ios) == 0, &lwi);
00725         }
00726         RETURN(0);
00727 }
00728 
00729 static int lov_layout_change(const struct lu_env *unused,
00730                              struct lov_object *lov, struct lov_stripe_md *lsm,
00731                              const struct cl_object_conf *conf)
00732 {
00733         enum lov_layout_type llt = lov_type(lsm);
00734         union lov_layout_state *state = &lov->u;
00735         const struct lov_layout_operations *old_ops;
00736         const struct lov_layout_operations *new_ops;
00737         void *cookie;
00738         struct lu_env *env;
00739         __u16 refcheck;
00740         int rc;
00741         ENTRY;
00742 
00743         LASSERT(0 <= lov->lo_type && lov->lo_type < ARRAY_SIZE(lov_dispatch));
00744 
00745         cookie = cl_env_reenter();
00746         env = cl_env_get(&refcheck);
00747         if (IS_ERR(env)) {
00748                 cl_env_reexit(cookie);
00749                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(env));
00750         }
00751 
00752         LASSERT(0 <= llt && llt < ARRAY_SIZE(lov_dispatch));
00753 
00754         CDEBUG(D_INODE, DFID" from %s to %s\n",
00755                PFID(lu_object_fid(lov2lu(lov))),
00756                llt2str(lov->lo_type), llt2str(llt));
00757 
00758         old_ops = &lov_dispatch[lov->lo_type];
00759         new_ops = &lov_dispatch[llt];
00760 
00761         rc = cl_object_prune(env, &lov->lo_cl);
00762         if (rc != 0)
00763                 GOTO(out, rc);
00764 
00765         rc = old_ops->llo_delete(env, lov, &lov->u);
00766         if (rc != 0)
00767                 GOTO(out, rc);
00768 
00769         old_ops->llo_fini(env, lov, &lov->u);
00770 
00771         LASSERT(atomic_read(&lov->lo_active_ios) == 0);
00772 
00773         lov->lo_type = LLT_EMPTY;
00774 
00775         /* page bufsize fixup */
00776         cl_object_header(&lov->lo_cl)->coh_page_bufsize -=
00777                 lov_page_slice_fixup(lov, NULL);
00778 
00779         rc = new_ops->llo_init(env, lov_object_dev(lov), lov, lsm, conf, state);
00780         if (rc != 0) {
00781                 new_ops->llo_delete(env, lov, state);
00782                 new_ops->llo_fini(env, lov, state);
00783                 /* this file becomes an EMPTY file. */
00784                 GOTO(out, rc);
00785         }
00786 
00787         new_ops->llo_install(env, lov, state);
00788         lov->lo_type = llt;
00789 
00790 out:
00791         cl_env_put(env, &refcheck);
00792         cl_env_reexit(cookie);
00793 
00794         RETURN(rc);
00795 }
00796 
00797 /*****************************************************************************
00798  *
00799  * Lov object operations.
00800  *
00801  */
00802 int lov_object_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_object *obj,
00803                     const struct lu_object_conf *conf)
00804 {
00805         struct lov_object            *lov   = lu2lov(obj);
00806         struct lov_device            *dev   = lov_object_dev(lov);
00807         const struct cl_object_conf  *cconf = lu2cl_conf(conf);
00808         union lov_layout_state       *set   = &lov->u;
00809         const struct lov_layout_operations *ops;
00810         struct lov_stripe_md *lsm = NULL;
00811         int rc;
00812         ENTRY;
00813 
00814         init_rwsem(&lov->lo_type_guard);
00815         atomic_set(&lov->lo_active_ios, 0);
00816         init_waitqueue_head(&lov->lo_waitq);
00817         cl_object_page_init(lu2cl(obj), sizeof(struct lov_page));
00818 
00819         lov->lo_type = LLT_EMPTY;
00820         if (cconf->u.coc_layout.lb_buf != NULL) {
00821                 lsm = lov_unpackmd(dev->ld_lov,
00822                                    cconf->u.coc_layout.lb_buf,
00823                                    cconf->u.coc_layout.lb_len);
00824                 if (IS_ERR(lsm))
00825                         RETURN(PTR_ERR(lsm));
00826         }
00827 
00828         /* no locking is necessary, as object is being created */
00829         lov->lo_type = lov_type(lsm);
00830         ops = &lov_dispatch[lov->lo_type];
00831         rc = ops->llo_init(env, dev, lov, lsm, cconf, set);
00832         if (rc != 0)
00833                 GOTO(out_lsm, rc);
00834 
00835         ops->llo_install(env, lov, set);
00836 
00837 out_lsm:
00838         lov_lsm_put(lsm);
00839 
00840         RETURN(rc);
00841 }
00842 
00843 static int lov_conf_set(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_object *obj,
00844                         const struct cl_object_conf *conf)
00845 {
00846         struct lov_stripe_md    *lsm = NULL;
00847         struct lov_object       *lov = cl2lov(obj);
00848         int                      result = 0;
00849         ENTRY;
00850 
00851         if (conf->coc_opc == OBJECT_CONF_SET &&
00852             conf->u.coc_layout.lb_buf != NULL) {
00853                 lsm = lov_unpackmd(lov_object_dev(lov)->ld_lov,
00854                                    conf->u.coc_layout.lb_buf,
00855                                    conf->u.coc_layout.lb_len);
00856                 if (IS_ERR(lsm))
00857                         RETURN(PTR_ERR(lsm));
00858         }
00859 
00860         lov_conf_lock(lov);
00861         if (conf->coc_opc == OBJECT_CONF_INVALIDATE) {
00862                 lov->lo_layout_invalid = true;
00863                 GOTO(out, result = 0);
00864         }
00865 
00866         if (conf->coc_opc == OBJECT_CONF_WAIT) {
00867                 if (lov->lo_layout_invalid &&
00868                     atomic_read(&lov->lo_active_ios) > 0) {
00869                         lov_conf_unlock(lov);
00870                         result = lov_layout_wait(env, lov);
00871                         lov_conf_lock(lov);
00872                 }
00873                 GOTO(out, result);
00874         }
00875 
00876         LASSERT(conf->coc_opc == OBJECT_CONF_SET);
00877 
00878         if ((lsm == NULL && lov->lo_lsm == NULL) ||
00879             ((lsm != NULL && lov->lo_lsm != NULL) &&
00880              (lov->lo_lsm->lsm_layout_gen == lsm->lsm_layout_gen) &&
00881              (lov->lo_lsm->lsm_pattern == lsm->lsm_pattern))) {
00882                 /* same version of layout */
00883                 lov->lo_layout_invalid = false;
00884                 GOTO(out, result = 0);
00885         }
00886 
00887         /* will change layout - check if there still exists active IO. */
00888         if (atomic_read(&lov->lo_active_ios) > 0) {
00889                 lov->lo_layout_invalid = true;
00890                 GOTO(out, result = -EBUSY);
00891         }
00892 
00893         result = lov_layout_change(env, lov, lsm, conf);
00894         lov->lo_layout_invalid = result != 0;
00895         EXIT;
00896 
00897 out:
00898         lov_conf_unlock(lov);
00899         lov_lsm_put(lsm);
00900         CDEBUG(D_INODE, DFID" lo_layout_invalid=%d\n",
00901                PFID(lu_object_fid(lov2lu(lov))), lov->lo_layout_invalid);
00902         RETURN(result);
00903 }
00904 
00905 static void lov_object_delete(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_object *obj)
00906 {
00907         struct lov_object *lov = lu2lov(obj);
00908 
00909         ENTRY;
00910         LOV_2DISPATCH_VOID(lov, llo_delete, env, lov, &lov->u);
00911         EXIT;
00912 }
00913 
00914 static void lov_object_free(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_object *obj)
00915 {
00916         struct lov_object *lov = lu2lov(obj);
00917 
00918         ENTRY;
00919         LOV_2DISPATCH_VOID(lov, llo_fini, env, lov, &lov->u);
00920         lu_object_fini(obj);
00921         OBD_SLAB_FREE_PTR(lov, lov_object_kmem);
00922         EXIT;
00923 }
00924 
00925 static int lov_object_print(const struct lu_env *env, void *cookie,
00926                             lu_printer_t p, const struct lu_object *o)
00927 {
00928         return LOV_2DISPATCH_NOLOCK(lu2lov(o), llo_print, env, cookie, p, o);
00929 }
00930 
00931 int lov_page_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_object *obj,
00932                   struct cl_page *page, pgoff_t index)
00933 {
00934         return LOV_2DISPATCH_NOLOCK(cl2lov(obj), llo_page_init, env, obj, page,
00935                                     index);
00936 }
00937 
00942 int lov_io_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_object *obj,
00943                 struct cl_io *io)
00944 {
00945         CL_IO_SLICE_CLEAN(lov_env_io(env), lis_cl);
00946         return LOV_2DISPATCH_MAYLOCK(cl2lov(obj), llo_io_init,
00947                                      !io->ci_ignore_layout, env, obj, io);
00948 }
00949 
00955 static int lov_attr_get(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_object *obj,
00956                         struct cl_attr *attr)
00957 {
00958         /* do not take lock, as this function is called under a
00959          * spin-lock. Layout is protected from changing by ongoing IO. */
00960         return LOV_2DISPATCH_NOLOCK(cl2lov(obj), llo_getattr, env, obj, attr);
00961 }
00962 
00963 static int lov_attr_update(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_object *obj,
00964                            const struct cl_attr *attr, unsigned valid)
00965 {
00966         /*
00967          * No dispatch is required here, as no layout implements this.
00968          */
00969         return 0;
00970 }
00971 
00972 int lov_lock_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_object *obj,
00973                   struct cl_lock *lock, const struct cl_io *io)
00974 {
00975         /* No need to lock because we've taken one refcount of layout.  */
00976         return LOV_2DISPATCH_NOLOCK(cl2lov(obj), llo_lock_init, env, obj, lock,
00977                                     io);
00978 }
00979 
00997 static int fiemap_calc_last_stripe(struct lov_stripe_md *lsm,
00998                                    loff_t fm_start, loff_t fm_end,
00999                                    int start_stripe, int *stripe_count)
01000 {
01001         int last_stripe;
01002         loff_t obd_start;
01003         loff_t obd_end;
01004         int i, j;
01005 
01006         if (fm_end - fm_start > lsm->lsm_stripe_size * lsm->lsm_stripe_count) {
01007                 last_stripe = (start_stripe < 1 ? lsm->lsm_stripe_count - 1 :
01008                                                               start_stripe - 1);
01009                 *stripe_count = lsm->lsm_stripe_count;
01010         } else {
01011                 for (j = 0, i = start_stripe; j < lsm->lsm_stripe_count;
01012                      i = (i + 1) % lsm->lsm_stripe_count, j++) {
01013                         if ((lov_stripe_intersects(lsm, i, fm_start, fm_end,
01014                                                    &obd_start, &obd_end)) == 0)
01015                                 break;
01016                 }
01017                 *stripe_count = j;
01018                 last_stripe = (start_stripe + j - 1) % lsm->lsm_stripe_count;
01019         }
01020 
01021         return last_stripe;
01022 }
01023 
01034 static void fiemap_prepare_and_copy_exts(struct fiemap *fiemap,
01035                                          struct fiemap_extent *lcl_fm_ext,
01036                                          int ost_index, unsigned int ext_count,
01037                                          int current_extent)
01038 {
01039         char            *to;
01040         unsigned int    ext;
01041 
01042         for (ext = 0; ext < ext_count; ext++) {
01043                 lcl_fm_ext[ext].fe_device = ost_index;
01044                 lcl_fm_ext[ext].fe_flags |= FIEMAP_EXTENT_NET;
01045         }
01046 
01047         /* Copy fm_extent's from fm_local to return buffer */
01048         to = (char *)fiemap + fiemap_count_to_size(current_extent);
01049         memcpy(to, lcl_fm_ext, ext_count * sizeof(struct fiemap_extent));
01050 }
01051 
01052 #define FIEMAP_BUFFER_SIZE 4096
01053 
01071 static loff_t fiemap_calc_fm_end_offset(struct fiemap *fiemap,
01072                                         struct lov_stripe_md *lsm,
01073                                         loff_t fm_start, loff_t fm_end,
01074                                         int *start_stripe)
01075 {
01076         loff_t local_end = fiemap->fm_extents[0].fe_logical;
01077         loff_t lun_start;
01078         loff_t lun_end;
01079         loff_t fm_end_offset;
01080         int stripe_no = -1;
01081         int i;
01082 
01083         if (fiemap->fm_extent_count == 0 ||
01084             fiemap->fm_extents[0].fe_logical == 0)
01085                 return 0;
01086 
01087         /* Find out stripe_no from ost_index saved in the fe_device */
01088         for (i = 0; i < lsm->lsm_stripe_count; i++) {
01089                 struct lov_oinfo *oinfo = lsm->lsm_oinfo[i];
01090 
01091                 if (lov_oinfo_is_dummy(oinfo))
01092                         continue;
01093 
01094                 if (oinfo->loi_ost_idx == fiemap->fm_extents[0].fe_device) {
01095                         stripe_no = i;
01096                         break;
01097                 }
01098         }
01099 
01100         if (stripe_no == -1)
01101                 return -EINVAL;
01102 
01103         /* If we have finished mapping on previous device, shift logical
01104          * offset to start of next device */
01105         if (lov_stripe_intersects(lsm, stripe_no, fm_start, fm_end,
01106                                   &lun_start, &lun_end) != 0 &&
01107             local_end < lun_end) {
01108                 fm_end_offset = local_end;
01109                 *start_stripe = stripe_no;
01110         } else {
01111                 /* This is a special value to indicate that caller should
01112                  * calculate offset in next stripe. */
01113                 fm_end_offset = 0;
01114                 *start_stripe = (stripe_no + 1) % lsm->lsm_stripe_count;
01115         }
01116 
01117         return fm_end_offset;
01118 }
01119 
01134 static int lov_object_fiemap(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_object *obj,
01135                              struct ll_fiemap_info_key *fmkey,
01136                              struct fiemap *fiemap, size_t *buflen)
01137 {
01138         struct lov_stripe_md    *lsm;
01139         struct cl_object        *subobj = NULL;
01140         struct lov_obd          *lov = lu2lov_dev(obj->co_lu.lo_dev)->ld_lov;
01141         struct fiemap           *fm_local = NULL;
01142         struct fiemap_extent    *lcl_fm_ext;
01143         loff_t                  fm_start;
01144         loff_t                  fm_end;
01145         loff_t                  fm_length;
01146         loff_t                  fm_end_offset;
01147         int                     count_local;
01148         int                     ost_index = 0;
01149         int                     start_stripe;
01150         int                     current_extent = 0;
01151         int                     rc = 0;
01152         int                     last_stripe;
01153         int                     cur_stripe = 0;
01154         int                     cur_stripe_wrap = 0;
01155         int                     stripe_count;
01156         unsigned int            buffer_size = FIEMAP_BUFFER_SIZE;
01157         /* Whether have we collected enough extents */
01158         bool                    enough = false;
01159         /* EOF for object */
01160         bool                    ost_eof = false;
01161         /* done with required mapping for this OST? */
01162         bool                    ost_done = false;
01163         ENTRY;
01164 
01165         lsm = lov_lsm_addref(cl2lov(obj));
01166         if (lsm == NULL)
01167                 RETURN(-ENODATA);
01168 
01173         if (lsm->lsm_stripe_count > 1 && !(fiemap->fm_flags &
01174                                            FIEMAP_FLAG_DEVICE_ORDER))
01175                 GOTO(out_lsm, rc = -ENOTSUPP);
01176 
01177         if (lsm_is_released(lsm)) {
01178                 if (fiemap->fm_start < fmkey->lfik_oa.o_size) {
01183                         fiemap->fm_mapped_extents = 1;
01184                         fiemap->fm_extents[0].fe_logical = fiemap->fm_start;
01185                         if (fiemap->fm_start + fiemap->fm_length <
01186                             fmkey->lfik_oa.o_size)
01187                                 fiemap->fm_extents[0].fe_length =
01188                                         fiemap->fm_length;
01189                         else
01190                                 fiemap->fm_extents[0].fe_length =
01191                                         fmkey->lfik_oa.o_size -
01192                                         fiemap->fm_start;
01193                         fiemap->fm_extents[0].fe_flags |=
01194                                 FIEMAP_EXTENT_UNKNOWN | FIEMAP_EXTENT_LAST;
01195                 }
01196                 GOTO(out_lsm, rc = 0);
01197         }
01198 
01199         if (fiemap_count_to_size(fiemap->fm_extent_count) < buffer_size)
01200                 buffer_size = fiemap_count_to_size(fiemap->fm_extent_count);
01201 
01202         OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(fm_local, buffer_size);
01203         if (fm_local == NULL)
01204                 GOTO(out_lsm, rc = -ENOMEM);
01205         lcl_fm_ext = &fm_local->fm_extents[0];
01206         count_local = fiemap_size_to_count(buffer_size);
01207 
01208         fm_start = fiemap->fm_start;
01209         fm_length = fiemap->fm_length;
01210         /* Calculate start stripe, last stripe and length of mapping */
01211         start_stripe = lov_stripe_number(lsm, fm_start);
01212         fm_end = (fm_length == ~0ULL) ? fmkey->lfik_oa.o_size :
01213                                         fm_start + fm_length - 1;
01214         /* If fm_length != ~0ULL but fm_start_fm_length-1 exceeds file size */
01215         if (fm_end > fmkey->lfik_oa.o_size)
01216                 fm_end = fmkey->lfik_oa.o_size;
01217 
01218         last_stripe = fiemap_calc_last_stripe(lsm, fm_start, fm_end,
01219                                               start_stripe, &stripe_count);
01220         fm_end_offset = fiemap_calc_fm_end_offset(fiemap, lsm, fm_start, fm_end,
01221                                                   &start_stripe);
01222         if (fm_end_offset == -EINVAL)
01223                 GOTO(out_fm_local, rc = -EINVAL);
01224 
01229         if (fiemap_count_to_size(fiemap->fm_extent_count) > *buflen)
01230                 fiemap->fm_extent_count = fiemap_size_to_count(*buflen);
01231         if (fiemap->fm_extent_count == 0)
01232                 count_local = 0;
01233 
01234         /* Check each stripe */
01235         for (cur_stripe = start_stripe; stripe_count > 0;
01236              --stripe_count,
01237              cur_stripe = (cur_stripe + 1) % lsm->lsm_stripe_count) {
01238                 loff_t req_fm_len; /* Stores length of required mapping */
01239                 loff_t len_mapped_single_call;
01240                 loff_t lun_start;
01241                 loff_t lun_end;
01242                 loff_t obd_object_end;
01243                 unsigned int ext_count;
01244 
01245                 cur_stripe_wrap = cur_stripe;
01246 
01247                 /* Find out range of mapping on this stripe */
01248                 if ((lov_stripe_intersects(lsm, cur_stripe, fm_start, fm_end,
01249                                            &lun_start, &obd_object_end)) == 0)
01250                         continue;
01251 
01252                 if (lov_oinfo_is_dummy(lsm->lsm_oinfo[cur_stripe]))
01253                         GOTO(out_fm_local, rc = -EIO);
01254 
01255                 /* If this is a continuation FIEMAP call and we are on
01256                  * starting stripe then lun_start needs to be set to
01257                  * fm_end_offset */
01258                 if (fm_end_offset != 0 && cur_stripe == start_stripe)
01259                         lun_start = fm_end_offset;
01260 
01261                 if (fm_length != ~0ULL) {
01262                         /* Handle fm_start + fm_length overflow */
01263                         if (fm_start + fm_length < fm_start)
01264                                 fm_length = ~0ULL - fm_start;
01265                         lun_end = lov_size_to_stripe(lsm, fm_start + fm_length,
01266                                                      cur_stripe);
01267                 } else {
01268                         lun_end = ~0ULL;
01269                 }
01270 
01271                 if (lun_start == lun_end)
01272                         continue;
01273 
01274                 req_fm_len = obd_object_end - lun_start;
01275                 fm_local->fm_length = 0;
01276                 len_mapped_single_call = 0;
01277 
01278                 /* find lobsub object */
01279                 subobj = lov_find_subobj(env, cl2lov(obj), lsm,
01280                                              cur_stripe);
01281                 if (IS_ERR(subobj))
01282                         GOTO(out_fm_local, rc = PTR_ERR(subobj));
01283                 /* If the output buffer is very large and the objects have many
01284                  * extents we may need to loop on a single OST repeatedly */
01285                 ost_eof = false;
01286                 ost_done = false;
01287                 do {
01288                         if (fiemap->fm_extent_count > 0) {
01289                                 /* Don't get too many extents. */
01290                                 if (current_extent + count_local >
01291                                     fiemap->fm_extent_count)
01292                                         count_local = fiemap->fm_extent_count -
01293                                                       current_extent;
01294                         }
01295 
01296                         lun_start += len_mapped_single_call;
01297                         fm_local->fm_length = req_fm_len -
01298                                               len_mapped_single_call;
01299                         req_fm_len = fm_local->fm_length;
01300                         fm_local->fm_extent_count = enough ? 1 : count_local;
01301                         fm_local->fm_mapped_extents = 0;
01302                         fm_local->fm_flags = fiemap->fm_flags;
01303 
01304                         ost_index = lsm->lsm_oinfo[cur_stripe]->loi_ost_idx;
01305 
01306                         if (ost_index < 0 ||
01307                             ost_index >= lov->desc.ld_tgt_count)
01308                                 GOTO(obj_put, rc = -EINVAL);
01309                         /* If OST is inactive, return extent with UNKNOWN
01310                          * flag. */
01311                         if (!lov->lov_tgts[ost_index]->ltd_active) {
01312                                 fm_local->fm_flags |= FIEMAP_EXTENT_LAST;
01313                                 fm_local->fm_mapped_extents = 1;
01314 
01315                                 lcl_fm_ext[0].fe_logical = lun_start;
01316                                 lcl_fm_ext[0].fe_length = obd_object_end -
01317                                                           lun_start;
01318                                 lcl_fm_ext[0].fe_flags |= FIEMAP_EXTENT_UNKNOWN;
01319 
01320                                 goto inactive_tgt;
01321                         }
01322 
01323                         fm_local->fm_start = lun_start;
01324                         fm_local->fm_flags &= ~FIEMAP_FLAG_DEVICE_ORDER;
01325                         memcpy(&fmkey->lfik_fiemap, fm_local,
01326                                sizeof(*fm_local));
01327                         *buflen = fiemap_count_to_size(
01328                                                 fm_local->fm_extent_count);
01329 
01330                         rc = cl_object_fiemap(env, subobj, fmkey, fm_local,
01331                                               buflen);
01332                         if (rc != 0)
01333                                 GOTO(obj_put, rc);
01334 inactive_tgt:
01335                         ext_count = fm_local->fm_mapped_extents;
01336                         if (ext_count == 0) {
01337                                 ost_done = true;
01338                                 /* If last stripe has hold at the end,
01339                                  * we need to return */
01340                                 if (cur_stripe_wrap == last_stripe) {
01341                                         fiemap->fm_mapped_extents = 0;
01342                                         goto finish;
01343                                 }
01344                                 break;
01345                         } else if (enough) {
01346                                 /*
01347                                  * We've collected enough extents and there are
01348                                  * more extents after it.
01349                                  */
01350                                 goto finish;
01351                         }
01352 
01353                         /* If we just need num of extents, got to next device */
01354                         if (fiemap->fm_extent_count == 0) {
01355                                 current_extent += ext_count;
01356                                 break;
01357                         }
01358 
01359                         /* prepare to copy retrived map extents */
01360                         len_mapped_single_call =
01361                                 lcl_fm_ext[ext_count - 1].fe_logical -
01362                                 lun_start + lcl_fm_ext[ext_count - 1].fe_length;
01363 
01364                         /* Have we finished mapping on this device? */
01365                         if (req_fm_len <= len_mapped_single_call)
01366                                 ost_done = true;
01367 
01368                         /* Clear the EXTENT_LAST flag which can be present on
01369                          * the last extent */
01370                         if (lcl_fm_ext[ext_count - 1].fe_flags &
01371                             FIEMAP_EXTENT_LAST)
01372                                 lcl_fm_ext[ext_count - 1].fe_flags &=
01373                                                         ~FIEMAP_EXTENT_LAST;
01374                         if (lov_stripe_size(lsm,
01375                                         lcl_fm_ext[ext_count - 1].fe_logical +
01376                                         lcl_fm_ext[ext_count - 1].fe_length,
01377                                         cur_stripe) >= fmkey->lfik_oa.o_size)
01378                                 ost_eof = true;
01379 
01380                         fiemap_prepare_and_copy_exts(fiemap, lcl_fm_ext,
01381                                                      ost_index, ext_count,
01382                                                      current_extent);
01383                         current_extent += ext_count;
01384 
01385                         /* Ran out of available extents? */
01386                         if (current_extent >= fiemap->fm_extent_count)
01387                                 enough = true;
01388                 } while (!ost_done && !ost_eof);
01389 
01390                 cl_object_put(env, subobj);
01391                 subobj = NULL;
01392 
01393                 if (cur_stripe_wrap == last_stripe)
01394                         goto finish;
01395         } /* for each stripe */
01396 finish:
01397         /* Indicate that we are returning device offsets unless file just has
01398          * single stripe */
01399         if (lsm->lsm_stripe_count > 1)
01400                 fiemap->fm_flags |= FIEMAP_FLAG_DEVICE_ORDER;
01401 
01402         if (fiemap->fm_extent_count == 0)
01403                 goto skip_last_device_calc;
01404 
01405         /* Check if we have reached the last stripe and whether mapping for that
01406          * stripe is done. */
01407         if ((cur_stripe_wrap == last_stripe) && (ost_done || ost_eof))
01408                 fiemap->fm_extents[current_extent - 1].fe_flags |=
01409                                                              FIEMAP_EXTENT_LAST;
01410 skip_last_device_calc:
01411         fiemap->fm_mapped_extents = current_extent;
01412 obj_put:
01413         if (subobj != NULL)
01414                 cl_object_put(env, subobj);
01415 out_fm_local:
01416         OBD_FREE_LARGE(fm_local, buffer_size);
01417 
01418 out_lsm:
01419         lov_lsm_put(lsm);
01420 
01421         return rc;
01422 }
01423 
01424 static int lov_object_getstripe(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_object *obj,
01425                                 struct lov_user_md __user *lum)
01426 {
01427         struct lov_object       *lov = cl2lov(obj);
01428         struct lov_stripe_md    *lsm;
01429         int                     rc = 0;
01430         ENTRY;
01431 
01432         lsm = lov_lsm_addref(lov);
01433         if (lsm == NULL)
01434                 RETURN(-ENODATA);
01435 
01436         rc = lov_getstripe(cl2lov(obj), lsm, lum);
01437         lov_lsm_put(lsm);
01438         RETURN(rc);
01439 }
01440 
01441 static int lov_object_layout_get(const struct lu_env *env,
01442                                  struct cl_object *obj,
01443                                  struct cl_layout *cl)
01444 {
01445         struct lov_object *lov = cl2lov(obj);
01446         struct lov_stripe_md *lsm = lov_lsm_addref(lov);
01447         struct lu_buf *buf = &cl->cl_buf;
01448         ssize_t rc;
01449         ENTRY;
01450 
01451         if (lsm == NULL) {
01452                 cl->cl_size = 0;
01453                 cl->cl_layout_gen = CL_LAYOUT_GEN_EMPTY;
01454 
01455                 RETURN(0);
01456         }
01457 
01458         cl->cl_size = lov_mds_md_size(lsm->lsm_stripe_count, lsm->lsm_magic);
01459         cl->cl_layout_gen = lsm->lsm_layout_gen;
01460 
01461         rc = lov_lsm_pack(lsm, buf->lb_buf, buf->lb_len);
01462         lov_lsm_put(lsm);
01463 
01464         RETURN(rc < 0 ? rc : 0);
01465 }
01466 
01467 static loff_t lov_object_maxbytes(struct cl_object *obj)
01468 {
01469         struct lov_object *lov = cl2lov(obj);
01470         struct lov_stripe_md *lsm = lov_lsm_addref(lov);
01471         loff_t maxbytes;
01472 
01473         if (lsm == NULL)
01474                 return LLONG_MAX;
01475 
01476         maxbytes = lsm->lsm_maxbytes;
01477 
01478         lov_lsm_put(lsm);
01479 
01480         return maxbytes;
01481 }

01483 static const struct cl_object_operations lov_ops = {
01484         .coo_page_init    = lov_page_init,
01485         .coo_lock_init    = lov_lock_init,
01486         .coo_io_init      = lov_io_init,
01487         .coo_attr_get     = lov_attr_get,
01488         .coo_attr_update  = lov_attr_update,
01489         .coo_conf_set     = lov_conf_set,
01490         .coo_getstripe    = lov_object_getstripe,
01491         .coo_layout_get   = lov_object_layout_get,
01492         .coo_maxbytes     = lov_object_maxbytes,
01493         .coo_fiemap       = lov_object_fiemap,
01494 };
01495 
01496 static const struct lu_object_operations lov_lu_obj_ops = {
01497         .loo_object_init      = lov_object_init,
01498         .loo_object_delete    = lov_object_delete,
01499         .loo_object_release   = NULL,
01500         .loo_object_free      = lov_object_free,
01501         .loo_object_print     = lov_object_print,
01502         .loo_object_invariant = NULL
01503 };
01504 
01505 struct lu_object *lov_object_alloc(const struct lu_env *env,
01506                                    const struct lu_object_header *unused,
01507                                    struct lu_device *dev)
01508 {
01509         struct lov_object *lov;
01510         struct lu_object  *obj;
01511 
01512         ENTRY;
01513         OBD_SLAB_ALLOC_PTR_GFP(lov, lov_object_kmem, GFP_NOFS);
01514         if (lov != NULL) {
01515                 obj = lov2lu(lov);
01516                 lu_object_init(obj, NULL, dev);
01517                 lov->lo_cl.co_ops = &lov_ops;
01518                 lov->lo_type = -1; /* invalid, to catch uninitialized type */
01519                 /*
01520                  * object io operation vector (cl_object::co_iop) is installed
01521                  * later in lov_object_init(), as different vectors are used
01522                  * for object with different layouts.
01523                  */
01524                 obj->lo_ops = &lov_lu_obj_ops;
01525         } else
01526                 obj = NULL;
01527         RETURN(obj);
01528 }
01529 
01530 struct lov_stripe_md *lov_lsm_addref(struct lov_object *lov)
01531 {
01532         struct lov_stripe_md *lsm = NULL;
01533 
01534         lov_conf_freeze(lov);
01535         if (lov->lo_lsm != NULL) {
01536                 lsm = lsm_addref(lov->lo_lsm);
01537                 CDEBUG(D_INODE, "lsm %p addref %d/%d by %p.\n",
01538                         lsm, atomic_read(&lsm->lsm_refc),
01539                         lov->lo_layout_invalid, current);
01540         }
01541         lov_conf_thaw(lov);
01542         return lsm;
01543 }
01544 
01545 int lov_read_and_clear_async_rc(struct cl_object *clob)
01546 {
01547         struct lu_object *luobj;
01548         int rc = 0;
01549         ENTRY;
01550 
01551         luobj = lu_object_locate(&cl_object_header(clob)->coh_lu,
01552                                  &lov_device_type);
01553         if (luobj != NULL) {
01554                 struct lov_object *lov = lu2lov(luobj);
01555 
01556                 lov_conf_freeze(lov);
01557                 switch (lov->lo_type) {
01558                 case LLT_RAID0: {
01559                         struct lov_stripe_md *lsm;
01560                         int i;
01561 
01562                         lsm = lov->lo_lsm;
01563                         LASSERT(lsm != NULL);
01564                         for (i = 0; i < lsm->lsm_stripe_count; i++) {
01565                                 struct lov_oinfo *loi = lsm->lsm_oinfo[i];
01566 
01567                                 if (lov_oinfo_is_dummy(loi))
01568                                         continue;
01569 
01570                                 if (loi->loi_ar.ar_rc && !rc)
01571                                         rc = loi->loi_ar.ar_rc;
01572                                 loi->loi_ar.ar_rc = 0;
01573                         }
01574                 }
01575                 case LLT_RELEASED:
01576                 case LLT_EMPTY:
01577                         break;
01578                 default:
01579                         LBUG();
01580                 }
01581                 lov_conf_thaw(lov);
01582         }
01583         RETURN(rc);
01584 }
01585 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lov_read_and_clear_async_rc);
